intro: Picramnia monochlamydea, commonly known as the single-chambered picramnia, is a deciduous shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
